sentences.en: A fifth order, the Servites, founded in 1233, was acknowledged as mendicant order in 1424.
sentences.cn: 第五一声令下, servites, 成立于1233年, 被认定为乞讨,以便在1424年.

sentences.en: A member of a usually mendicant Roman Catholic order.
sentences.cn: 托钵修会修士常化缘的罗马天主教会成员.

sentences.en: He seemed not an ordinary mendicant.
sentences.cn: 他好象不是寻常的乞丐。

sentences.en: Long after this, in a street in Bolpur, a mendicant Baul was singing as he walked along
sentences.cn: 很久以后，在鲍尔普尔的一条街上，一个行乞的歌手一面走一面唱

sentences.en: The mendicant say: "if I called ten sound?" Women happy replied: "that I will give one thousand! "
sentences.cn: 乞丐说：“我要是叫十声呢？”富婆开心答道：“那我就给一千！”

sentences.en: This dear little naked mendicant pretends to be utterly helpless, so that he may beg for mother's wealth of love.
sentences.cn: 这个亲爱的赤裸的小小的乞儿，故意装做完全无助的样子，想要以此来乞求妈妈满溢的爱。

sentences.en: This dear little naked mendicant pretends to be utterly helpless.
sentences.cn: 这可爱的赤裸的乞儿,假装全然无助.

sentences.en: This man, in his attire, as in all his person, realized the type of what may be called the well-bred mendicant,--extreme wretchedness combined with extreme cleanliness.
sentences.cn: 那人，从他的服装和神气看去，是极其穷苦而又极其整洁的，可以说是体现了人们称为高等乞丐的那一种。

trans.tran_cn: 行乞的，（指男修士）托钵僧的

trans.tran_en: someone who asks people for money in order to live, usually for religious reasons
